issues.description: The Stock class in the template defines findStockIngredient with signature findStockIngredient(String name, boolean caseSensitive), but both Stock.add/take and the problem UML expect a method findStockIngredient(String). The template’s add(String) and take(String) calls to findStockIngredient(String) won’t compile, and students will be confused about which signature to implement. The solution and the UML both use findStockIngredient(String): StockIngredient.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template’s Stock class to define a single method public StockIngredient findStockIngredient(String name) (removing or overloading the boolean parameter) so it matches the UML and solution. Adjust or remove the two-parameter version, and ensure Stock.add/take use the one-parameter signature.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies a Stock.findStockIngredient(String): StockIngredient method, but the template defines only findStockIngredient(String, boolean). This signature mismatch will confuse students who expect to call findStockIngredient with a single String parameter as described in the requirements.
issues.suggested_fix: Provide an overloaded method findStockIngredient(String name) in the Stock class (template) that matches the problem specification and delegates to the existing two-parameter version, or adjust the template to use a single-parameter signature as outlined in the problem statement.
